article.headline: Illinois St. 73, Ill.-Chicago 47
article.story: NORMAL, Ill. (AP) -- Levi Dyer came off the bench to score a game-high 25 points and led Illinois State to a 73-47 victory over Illinois-Chicago Saturday night. The Redbirds (5-2) and the Flames (3-4) went into halftime tied 29-29. But Illinois State blew it open in the second half, leading by as many as 30 point with 04:28 left to play. Osiris Eldridge, the only starter for the Redbirds in double digits, had 13 points. Josh Mayo and Robert Kreps led the Flames in scoring with 10 each. The Flames shot 41.7 percent (10-for-24) from the field in the first half, but managed a mere 18.5 percent (5-of-27) in the second. The Redbirds shot 56.6 percent (30-of-53) from the field for the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
